Assumption 5.2.

Assume there exists α>1𝛼1\alpha>1italic_α > 1 such that,

i⁢n⁢fθ:‖θ−θ∗‖≥δ𝒥𝐡⁢(θ)−𝒥𝐡⁢(θ∗)≥C𝐡⁢δαsubscript𝑖𝑛𝑓:𝜃norm𝜃superscript𝜃𝛿subscript𝒥𝐡𝜃subscript𝒥𝐡superscript𝜃subscript𝐶𝐡superscript𝛿𝛼\mathop{inf}_{\theta:||\theta-\theta^{*}||\geq\delta}\mathcal{J}_{\mathbf{h}}(% \theta)-\mathcal{J}_{\mathbf{h}}(\theta^{*})\geq C_{\mathbf{h}}\delta^{\alpha}start_BIGOP italic_i italic_n italic_f end_BIGOP start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ : | | italic_θ - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | ≥ italic_δ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) - caligraphic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ≥ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_δ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

holds for any small δ𝛿\deltaitalic_δ. Here, C𝐡subscript𝐶𝐡C_{\mathbf{h}}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a positive constant that depends on the weight function 𝐡𝐡\mathbf{h}bold_h such that Ca⁢𝐡=a⁢C𝐡subscript𝐶𝑎𝐡𝑎subscript𝐶𝐡C_{a\mathbf{h}}=aC_{\mathbf{h}}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any positive constant a𝑎aitalic_a. ∥⋅∥\|\cdot\|∥ ⋅ ∥ is the euclidean norm.

Assumption 5.3.

For ∀n∈ℕ+for-all𝑛superscriptℕ\forall n\in\mathbb{N}^{+}∀ italic_n ∈ blackboard_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, there exists An˙⁢(𝒯),Bn˙⁢(𝒯)˙subscript𝐴𝑛𝒯˙subscript𝐵𝑛𝒯\dot{A_{n}}(\mathcal{T}),\dot{B_{n}}(\mathcal{T})over˙ start_ARG italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( caligraphic_T ) , over˙ start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( caligraphic_T ) such that,

|An⁢(𝒯,θ1)−An⁢(𝒯,θ2)|≤An˙⁢(𝒯)⁢‖θ1−θ2‖,|Bn⁢(𝒯,θ1)−Bn⁢(𝒯,θ2)|≤Bn˙⁢(𝒯)⁢‖θ1−θ2‖.formulae-sequencesubscript𝐴𝑛𝒯subscript𝜃1subscript𝐴𝑛𝒯subscript𝜃2˙subscript𝐴𝑛𝒯normsubscript𝜃1subscript𝜃2subscript𝐵𝑛𝒯subscript𝜃1subscript𝐵𝑛𝒯subscript𝜃2˙subscript𝐵𝑛𝒯normsubscript𝜃1subscript𝜃2\displaystyle|A_{n}(\mathcal{T},\theta_{1})-A_{n}(\mathcal{T},\theta_{2})|\leq% \dot{A_{n}}(\mathcal{T})||\theta_{1}-\theta_{2}||,\ \ \ \ |B_{n}(\mathcal{T},% \theta_{1})-B_{n}(\mathcal{T},\theta_{2})|\leq\dot{B_{n}}(\mathcal{T})||\theta% _{1}-\theta_{2}||.| italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T , italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T , italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | ≤ over˙ start_ARG italic_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( caligraphic_T ) | | italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | | , | italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T , italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T , italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | ≤ over˙ start_ARG italic_B start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ( caligraphic_T ) | | italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | | .
Theorem 5.4.

Given that θ^^𝜃\hat{\theta}over^ start_ARG italic_θ end_ARG converges to θ∗superscript𝜃\theta^{*}italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in probability, combined with Assumptions 5.2 and 5.3, for δ<C⁢Kα⁢r2α−1⁢Γ⁢(𝐡,A,B)C𝐡𝛿𝐶subscript𝐾𝛼𝑟superscript2𝛼1Γ𝐡𝐴𝐵subscript𝐶𝐡\delta<CK_{\alpha}\frac{\sqrt{r}}{2^{\alpha-1}}\frac{\Gamma(\mathbf{h},A,B)}{C% _{\mathbf{h}}}italic_δ < italic_C italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG square-root start_ARG italic_r end_ARG end_ARG start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG divide start_ARG roman_Γ ( bold_h , italic_A , italic_B ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, we have

Pr⁢[‖θ^−θ∗‖≤(C⁢Kα⁢Γ⁢(𝐡,A,B)δ⁢C𝐡⁢rM1/(α−1))]≥1−δ,Prdelimited-[]norm^𝜃superscript𝜃𝐶subscript𝐾𝛼Γ𝐡𝐴𝐵𝛿subscript𝐶𝐡superscript𝑟𝑀1𝛼11𝛿\text{Pr}\left[||\hat{\theta}-\theta^{*}||\leq\left(CK_{\alpha}\frac{\Gamma(% \mathbf{h},A,B)}{\delta C_{\mathbf{h}}}\sqrt{\frac{r}{M}}^{1/(\alpha-1)}\right% )\right]\geq 1-\delta,Pr [ | | over^ start_ARG italic_θ end_ARG - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | ≤ ( italic_C italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG roman_Γ ( bold_h , italic_A , italic_B ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_r end_ARG start_ARG italic_M end_ARG end_ARG start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 / ( italic_α - 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ] ≥ 1 - italic_δ , (19)

where Γ⁢(𝐡,A,B)=𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢{∑n=1NT[(A˙n⁢(𝒯)⁢hn⁢(𝒯))+(B˙n⁢(𝒯)⁢∂hn⁢(𝒯)∂tn)]}2Γ𝐡𝐴𝐵subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇delimited-[]subscript˙𝐴𝑛𝒯subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯subscript˙𝐵𝑛𝒯subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛2\Gamma(\mathbf{h},A,B)=\sqrt{\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left\{\sum_{n=1}^{N_{% T}}\big{[}(\dot{A}_{n}(\mathcal{T})h_{n}(\mathcal{T}))+(\dot{B}_{n}(\mathcal{T% })\frac{\partial h_{n}(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}})\big{]}\right\}^{2}}roman_Γ ( bold_h , italic_A , italic_B ) = square-root start_ARG blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT { ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ ( over˙ start_ARG italic_A end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) ) + ( over˙ start_ARG italic_B end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) divide start_ARG ∂ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) ] } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG, C𝐶Citalic_C is a universal constant, Kα=22⁢α2α−1−1subscript𝐾𝛼superscript22𝛼superscript2𝛼11K_{\alpha}=\frac{2^{2\alpha}}{2^{\alpha-1}-1}italic_K start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_α end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 italic_α end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_α - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_ARG, and r𝑟ritalic_r is the number of dimensions of θ𝜃{\theta}italic_θ.

5.3 Discussion on Optimal Weight Function

In Sections 3 and 4, we only provide the conditions that the weight function needs to satisfy. In fact, there are many weight functions that satisfy these conditions. The optimal weight function should minimize the error bound in Equation 19, which is equivalent to minimizing the coefficient Γ⁢(𝐡,A,B)C𝐡Γ𝐡𝐴𝐵subscript𝐶𝐡\frac{\Gamma(\mathbf{h},A,B)}{C_{\mathbf{h}}}divide start_ARG roman_Γ ( bold_h , italic_A , italic_B ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. The numerator cannot be analytically computed as it involves an unknown distribution p⁢(𝒯)𝑝𝒯p(\mathcal{T})italic_p ( caligraphic_T ), but we can maximize the denominator C𝐡subscript𝐶𝐡C_{\mathbf{h}}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in a predefined function family.

Theorem 5.5.

Define 𝐡0superscript𝐡0\mathbf{h}^{0}bold_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT to be a weight function with its n𝑛nitalic_n-th element defined as the distance between tnsubscript𝑡𝑛t_{n}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the boundary of its support [tn−1,T]subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑇[t_{n-1},T][ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_T ]:

hn0⁢(tn)=T−tn−12−|tn−(T+tn−1)/2|.superscriptsubscriptℎ𝑛0subscript𝑡𝑛𝑇subscript𝑡𝑛12subscript𝑡𝑛𝑇subscript𝑡𝑛12h_{n}^{0}(t_{n})=\frac{T-t_{n-1}}{2}-|t_{n}-(T+t_{n-1})/2|.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG italic_T - italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG - | italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_T + italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) / 2 | .

We have,

𝒉0∈arg⁢max𝒉∈ℋ⁢infθ:‖θ−θ∗‖≥δ𝒥𝐡⁢(θ)−𝒥𝐡⁢(θ∗)superscript𝒉0subscriptargmax𝒉ℋsubscriptinf:𝜃norm𝜃superscript𝜃𝛿subscript𝒥𝐡𝜃subscript𝒥𝐡superscript𝜃\bm{h}^{0}\in\operatorname*{arg\,max}_{\bm{h}\in\mathcal{H}}\mathop{\text{inf}% }_{\theta:||\theta-\theta^{*}||\geq\delta}\mathcal{J}_{\mathbf{h}}(\theta)-% \mathcal{J}_{\mathbf{h}}(\theta^{*})bold_italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ start_OPERATOR roman_arg roman_max end_OPERATOR start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_italic_h ∈ caligraphic_H end_POSTSUBSCRIPT inf start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ : | | italic_θ - italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | ≥ italic_δ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) - caligraphic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

where ℋℋ\mathcal{H}caligraphic_H is a family of functions that is rigorously defined in Equation 27.

Combined with Assumption 5.2, it can be observed that 𝐡0superscript𝐡0\mathbf{h}^{0}bold_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT maximizes C𝐡subscript𝐶𝐡C_{\mathbf{h}}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT in ℋℋ\mathcal{H}caligraphic_H. Though it does not necessarily optimize Γ⁢(𝐡,A,B)C𝐡Γ𝐡𝐴𝐵subscript𝐶𝐡\frac{\Gamma(\mathbf{h},A,B)}{C_{\mathbf{h}}}divide start_ARG roman_Γ ( bold_h , italic_A , italic_B ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT bold_h end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, it is an adequate choice without using any information on p⁢(𝒯)𝑝𝒯p(\mathcal{T})italic_p ( caligraphic_T ). We also discuss it heuristically in Section C.4. It is worth noting that hn0superscriptsubscriptℎ𝑛0h_{n}^{0}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is not continuously differentiable; however, it is weakly differentiable. Its weak derivative is continuous, allowing both integration by parts and statistical theory to hold. In subsequent experiments, we consistently employ this optimal weight function when T𝑇Titalic_T is available or can be approximated for the dataset.

6 Experiments

In this section, we validate our proposed (A)WSM on parametric or deep point process models. For parametric models, we focus on verifying whether (A)WSM can accurately recover the ground-truth parameters. For deep point process models, we confirm that our new training method is also applicable to deep neural network models. 111Experiments are performed using an NVIDIA A16 GPU, 15GB memory.

6.1 Baselines and Metrics

We consider three baseline parameter estimators: (1) MLE (2) implicit (A)SM [18; 24; 10] (3) Denoising Score Matching (DSM) [10]. We briefly introduce DSM in deep point process models.

For deep Hawkes process training, DSM is employed as follows. For observed timestamps tn(m)superscriptsubscript𝑡𝑛𝑚t_{n}^{(m)}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT in m𝑚mitalic_m-th sequence, we sample L𝐿Litalic_L noise samples t~n,l(m)=tn(m)+ϵn,l(m),l=1,…,L,formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscript~𝑡𝑛𝑙𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑡𝑛𝑚superscriptsubscriptitalic-ϵ𝑛𝑙𝑚𝑙1…𝐿\tilde{t}_{n,l}^{(m)}=t_{n}^{(m)}+\epsilon_{n,l}^{(m)},l=1,\ldots,L,over~ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_l = 1 , … , italic_L , where Var⁢(εn,L(m))=σ2Varsuperscriptsubscript𝜀𝑛𝐿𝑚superscript𝜎2\text{Var}(\varepsilon_{n,L}^{(m)})=\sigma^{2}Var ( italic_ε start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and get the DSM objective:

𝒥^⁢(θ)=1M⁢∑m=1M∑n=1Nm∑l=1L12⁢L⁢[ψθ⁢(t~n,l(m)|ℱtn−1(m))+εn,l(m)σ2]+α⁢𝒥^CE⁢(θ),^𝒥𝜃1𝑀superscriptsubscript𝑚1𝑀superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑙1𝐿12𝐿delimited-[]subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsuperscriptsubscript~𝑡𝑛𝑙𝑚subscriptℱsuperscriptsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑚superscriptsubscript𝜀𝑛𝑙𝑚superscript𝜎2𝛼subscript^𝒥CE𝜃\hat{\mathcal{J}}(\theta)=\frac{1}{M}\sum_{m=1}^{M}\sum_{n=1}^{N_{m}}\sum_{l=1% }^{L}\frac{1}{2L}[\psi_{\theta}(\tilde{t}_{n,l}^{(m)}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}^{(m% )}})+\frac{\varepsilon_{n,l}^{(m)}}{\sigma^{2}}]+\alpha\hat{\mathcal{J}}_{% \text{CE}}(\theta),over^ start_ARG caligraphic_J end_ARG ( italic_θ ) = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_M end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_l = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_L end_ARG [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + divide start_ARG italic_ε start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n , italic_l end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ] + italic_α over^ start_ARG caligraphic_J end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT CE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ,

where 𝒥CE⁢(θ)subscript𝒥CE𝜃{\mathcal{J}}_{\text{CE}}(\theta)caligraphic_J start_POSTSUBSCRIPT CE end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) is the cross-entropy loss defined in Equation 18.

To compare the performance of different methods, for parametric models on synthetic data, we use the mean absolute error (MAE, |θ^−θ|^𝜃𝜃|\hat{\theta}-\theta|| over^ start_ARG italic_θ end_ARG - italic_θ |) between the ground-truth parameters and the estimates as a metric since the ground-truth parameters are known. For deep point process models, we use the test log-likelihood (TLL) and the event type prediction accuracy (ACC) on the test data as metrics.

6.2 Parametric Models

Datasets

We validate the effectiveness of (A)WSM using three sets of synthetic data. (1) Poisson Process: This dataset is simulated from an inhomogeneous Poisson process with an intensity function λ⁢(t)=exp⁡(θ⁢sin⁡(t))𝜆𝑡𝜃𝑡\lambda(t)=\exp(\theta\sin(t))italic_λ ( italic_t ) = roman_exp ( italic_θ roman_sin ( italic_t ) ) with T=2𝑇2T=2italic_T = 2, θ=2𝜃2\theta=2italic_θ = 2. (2) Exponential Hawkes Processes: This dataset is simulated from 2222-variate Hawkes processes with exponential decay triggering kernels gi⁢j⁢(τ)=αi⁢j⁢exp⁡(−5⁢τ),τ>0formulae-sequencesubscript𝑔𝑖𝑗𝜏subscript𝛼𝑖𝑗5𝜏𝜏0g_{ij}(\tau)=\alpha_{ij}\exp(-5\tau),\ \tau>0italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ ) = italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_exp ( - 5 italic_τ ) , italic_τ > 0 with T=10𝑇10T=10italic_T = 10, μ1=μ2=1subscript𝜇1subscript𝜇21\mu_{1}=\mu_{2}=1italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, α11=1.6,α12=0.2formulae-sequencesubscript𝛼111.6subscript𝛼120.2\alpha_{11}=1.6,\alpha_{12}=0.2italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 11 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1.6 , italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0.2, α21=α22=1subscript𝛼21subscript𝛼221\alpha_{21}=\alpha_{22}=1italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 21 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 22 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. (3) Gaussian Hawkes Processes: This dataset is simulated from 2222-variate Hawkes processes with Gaussian decay triggering kernels gi⁢j⁢(τ)=αi⁢j2⁢π⁢σ⁢exp⁡(−τ22⁢σ2),τ>0formulae-sequencesubscript𝑔𝑖𝑗𝜏subscript𝛼𝑖𝑗2𝜋𝜎superscript𝜏22superscript𝜎2𝜏0g_{ij}(\tau)=\frac{\alpha_{ij}}{\sqrt{2\pi}\sigma}\exp(-\frac{\tau^{2}}{2% \sigma^{2}}),\ \tau>0italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ ) = divide start_ARG italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG square-root start_ARG 2 italic_π end_ARG italic_σ end_ARG roman_exp ( - divide start_ARG italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 2 italic_σ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG ) , italic_τ > 0 with T=10𝑇10T=10italic_T = 10, μ1=μ2=1subscript𝜇1subscript𝜇21\mu_{1}=\mu_{2}=1italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_μ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, α11=1.6,α12=0.2formulae-sequencesubscript𝛼111.6subscript𝛼120.2\alpha_{11}=1.6,\alpha_{12}=0.2italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 11 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1.6 , italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 12 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0.2, α21=α22=1subscript𝛼21subscript𝛼221\alpha_{21}=\alpha_{22}=1italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 21 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 22 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1, σ=1𝜎1\sigma=1italic_σ = 1.

Training Protocol

We assume that we know the ground-truth model but do not know its parameters. Therefore, we use the ground-truth model as the training model. The purpose is to verify whether the estimator can recover the ground-truth parameters. For each dataset, we collect a total of 1000100010001000 sequences. We run 500500500500 iterations of gradient descent using Adam [8] as the optimizer for all scenarios. For MLE, the intensity integral is computed through numerical integration, with the number of integration nodes set to 100100100100 to achieve a considerable level of accuracy. We change the random seed 3333 times to compute the mean and standard deviation of MAE.

Results

In Table 1, we report the MAE of parameter estimates for three models trained by MLE, (A)SM, and (A)WSM on the synthetic dataset. We can see that both MLE and (A)WSM achieve small MAE on three types of data. However, the MAE of (A)SM is large. As we have theoretically demonstrated earlier, this is because MLE and (A)WSM estimators are consistent. In contrast, (A)SM, due to the absence of the required regularity conditions in the three cases, has an incomplete objective and cannot accurately estimate parameters. In Figure 1, we showcase the learned intensity functions. Both MLE and (A)WSM successfully captured the ground truth, while (A)SM fails.

6.3 Deep Point Processes Models

Datasets

We consider four real datasets. (1) Half-Sin Hawkes Process: This is a synthetic 2-variate Hawkes process with trigerring kernel gi⁢j=αi⁢j⁢s⁢i⁢n⁢(τ),τ∈(0,π)formulae-sequencesubscript𝑔𝑖𝑗subscript𝛼𝑖𝑗𝑠𝑖𝑛𝜏𝜏0𝜋g_{ij}=\alpha_{ij}sin(\tau),\tau\in(0,\pi)italic_g start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_α start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i italic_j end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s italic_i italic_n ( italic_τ ) , italic_τ ∈ ( 0 , italic_π ), K=2𝐾2K=2italic_K = 2. (2) StackOverflow [7]: This dataset has two years of user awards on StackOverflow. Each user received a sequence of badges and there are K=22𝐾22K=22italic_K = 22 kinds of badges. (3) Retweet [25]: This dataset includes sequences indicating how each novel tweets are forwarded by other users. Retweeter categories serve as event types K=3𝐾3K=3italic_K = 3. (4) Taobao [21]: This dataset comprises user activities on Taobao (in total K=17𝐾17K=17italic_K = 17 event types). For each dataset, we follow the default training/dev/testing split in the repository.

Training Protocol

In recent years, many deep point process models have been proposed. Here, we focus on two of the most popular attention-based Hawkes process models: SAHP [23] and THP [27]. We deploy AWSM and ASM on THP and SAHP. For each dataset, we train 3 seeds with the same epochs and report the mean and standard deviation of the best TLL and ACC. When using MLE, we adopt numerical integration to calculate the intensity integral. To ensure model accuracy, the number of integration nodes is set to be large enough as we sample 10 nodes between every two adjacent events. When using DSM, we tune the variance of noise for better results. When using AWSM, since for real datasets, the true observation endpoint T𝑇Titalic_T is unknown. We choose the maximum event time of each batch as the observation endpoint for weight function 𝒉0superscript𝒉0\bm{h}^{0}bold_italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. This may lead to unsatisfying results since real datasets may not be sampled during a unified time window. We provide a remedy for this as discussed in Section D.1. Details of training and testing hyperparameters are provided in Section D.2.

Results

In Table 2, we report the performance of SAHP and THP trained using three different methods, namely MLE, AWSM, and DSM, on four datasets. It is evident from the results that models trained with MLE and AWSM exhibit very similar performance in terms of both TLL and ACC on the test data. This indicates consistency between MLE and AWSM, as they yield comparable model parameters. For DSM, it is significantly inferior to the performance of MLE and AWSM. This may result from the fact that the DSM objective is a biased estimation of the original SM objective and fails to produce consistent estimation when σ>0𝜎0\sigma>0italic_σ > 0 as discussed in [20]. For ASM, it completely fails in the scenarios mentioned above. It is unable to estimate the correct parameters, and its results are not reported. Generally, for complex point process models such as deep Hawkes processes, the necessary regularity conditions are not satisfied, meaning that ASM’s objective is incomplete.

6.4 Advantage of (A)WSM over MLE

The key advantage of (A)WSM over MLE is its avoidance of computing intensity integrals, which can be computationally intensive for complex point process models and impact MLE accuracy. We evaluate the test log-likelihood of MLE and AWSM on the Exp-Hawkes dataset as the number of integration nodes varies. As shown in Figure 1, with a limited number of nodes, MLE is faster but exhibits substantial estimation errors. Increasing the number of nodes reduces the error but significantly increases computation time. In this scenario, AWSM is much faster than MLE with the same accuracy, thus offering better computational efficiency.

6.5 Comparison Between Weights

Though we provide theoretical insight into the choice of an optimal weight function for AWSM, its validity still needs to be testified by experiments. Here, we compare the near-optimal weight 𝒉0superscript𝒉0\bm{h}^{0}bold_italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with natural weight 𝒉1superscript𝒉1\bm{h}^{1}bold_italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and squareroot weight 𝒉2superscript𝒉2\bm{h}^{2}bold_italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT satisfying Equation 15,

hn1⁢(tn)=(tn−tn−1)⁢(T−tn),hn2⁢(tn)=(tn−tn−1)⁢(T−tn).formulae-sequencesuperscriptsubscriptℎ𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑇subscript𝑡𝑛superscriptsubscriptℎ𝑛2subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑇subscript𝑡𝑛h_{n}^{1}(t_{n})=(t_{n}-t_{n-1})(T-t_{n}),h_{n}^{2}(t_{n})=\sqrt{(t_{n}-t_{n-1% })(T-t_{n})}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_T - italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = square-root start_ARG ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_T - italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG .

All three weight functions can be applied in AWSM to recover ground-truth parameters, however with different convergence rates. We carry out experiments on synthetic data for exponential-decay model with the same setting as Section 6.2 in our paper. We measure their MAE for different sample sizes in Figure 2 and find that 𝐡𝟎superscript𝐡0\bf h^{0}bold_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT bold_0 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT does achieve the best results among the three weight functions.

7 Limitations

The current limitation of the methodology is that some real data are collected from multiple time intervals [0,T1],…,[0,TL]0subscript𝑇1…0subscript𝑇𝐿[0,T_{1}],\ldots,[0,T_{L}][ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] , … , [ 0 , italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_L end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or collated in a fixed time interval [0,T]0𝑇[0,T][ 0 , italic_T ] with unknown T𝑇Titalic_T. However, for a score matching to be valid, the required weight function must involve knowledge of T𝑇Titalic_T. Currently, our remedy including approximate T𝑇Titalic_T or performing data truncation as discussed in Section D.1.

8 Conclusions

In conclusion, the SM estimator for point processes can overcome the challenges associated with intensity integrals in MLE. While existing works have proposed SM estimators for point processes, our investigation reveals that they prove effective only for specific problems and fall short in more general cases. To address this issue, our work introduces a novel approach: the (A)WSM estimator for point processes, offering both theoretical soundness and empirical success.

Appendix A Proof of Results in Section 3

A.1 Proof of Proposition 3.1

The third equation uses an integral-by-part trick. All integrations above are taken within the area of {0≤t1≤…≤tN≤T}0subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁𝑇\{0\leq t_{1}\leq\ldots\leq t_{N}\leq T\}{ 0 ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ … ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_T } or {0≤t1≤…≤tn−1≤tn+1≤…≤tN≤T}0subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛1…subscript𝑡𝑁𝑇\{0\leq t_{1}\leq\ldots\leq t_{n-1}\leq t_{n+1}\leq\ldots\leq t_{N}\leq T\}{ 0 ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ … ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ … ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_T } when tnsubscript𝑡𝑛t_{n}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT has been integrated. For the first term in the right side of the last equation, notice that,

∂log⁡pθ⁢(t1,…,tN)∂tN=∂∂tn⁢log⁡λθ⁢(tn),∂∂tn⁢log⁡λθ⁢(tn)|tn=tn−1=∂∂tn−1⁢log⁡λθ⁢(tn−1)|tn−1=tn.formulae-sequencesubscript𝑝𝜃subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜆𝜃subscript𝑡𝑛evaluated-atsubscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜆𝜃subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛1evaluated-atsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝜆𝜃subscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})}{\partial t_{N}}=\frac{% \partial}{\partial t_{n}}\log\lambda_{\theta}(t_{n}),\ \ \ \ \frac{\partial}{% \partial t_{n}}\log\lambda_{\theta}(t_{n})\big{|}_{t_{n}=t_{n-1}}=\frac{% \partial}{\partial t_{n-1}}\log\lambda_{\theta}(t_{n-1})|_{t_{n-1}=t_{n}}.divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . (21)

Therefore, we can see that, for n∈{2,…,n}𝑛2…𝑛n\in\{2,\ldots,n\}italic_n ∈ { 2 , … , italic_n },

∫[p⁢(t1,…,tN)⁢∂log⁡pθ⁢(t1,…,tN)∂tn−1]|tn−1=tn⁢d⁢𝒯−(n−1)evaluated-atdelimited-[]𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑝𝜃subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛𝑑subscript𝒯𝑛1\displaystyle\int[p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(t_{1},% \ldots,t_{N})}{\partial t_{n-1}}]\big{|}_{t_{n-1}=t_{n}}d\mathcal{T}_{-(n-1)}∫ [ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - ( italic_n - 1 ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=\displaystyle== ∫[p⁢(t1,…,tN)⁢∂log⁡pθ⁢(t1,…,tN)∂tn]|tn=tn−1⁢d⁢𝒯−n.evaluated-atdelimited-[]𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑝𝜃subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑑subscript𝒯𝑛\displaystyle\int[p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(t_{1},% \ldots,t_{N})}{\partial t_{n}}]\big{|}_{t_{n}=t_{n-1}}d\mathcal{T}_{-n}.∫ [ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Using the above equation, we manage to cancel out most of the terms being summed in the right side of the thrid equation in Equation 20 and only leave the first and last term, which completes the proof.

∎

A.2 Proof of Theorem 3.2

Proof.

First, since ℒWSM⁢(θ)≥0subscriptℒWSM𝜃0\mathcal{L}_{\text{WSM}}(\theta)\geq 0caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT WSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ≥ 0 and ℒWSM⁢(θ∗)=0subscriptℒWSMsuperscript𝜃0\mathcal{L}_{\text{WSM}}(\theta^{*})=0caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT WSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = 0, we see θ∗superscript𝜃\theta^{*}italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a minimizer. If there exists another minimizer θ1subscript𝜃1\theta_{1}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then we have

ℒWSM⁢(θ)=∑N=1∞∫∑n=1N[∂∂tn⁢log⁡λθ∗⁢(tn)−∂∂tn⁢log⁡λθ1⁢(tn)]2⁢hn⁢(𝒯)⁢d⁢𝒯.subscriptℒWSM𝜃superscriptsubscript𝑁1superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁superscriptdelimited-[]subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜆superscript𝜃subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜆subscript𝜃1subscript𝑡𝑛2subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯𝑑𝒯\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{WSM}}(\theta)=\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\int\sum_{n=1% }^{N}\left[\frac{\partial}{\partial t_{n}}\log\lambda_{\theta^{*}}(t_{n})-% \frac{\partial}{\partial t_{n}}\log\lambda_{\theta_{1}}(t_{n})\right]^{2}h_{n}% (\mathcal{T})d\mathcal{T}.caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT WSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) italic_d caligraphic_T .

By the definition of 𝐡⁢(𝒯)𝐡𝒯\mathbf{h}(\mathcal{T})bold_h ( caligraphic_T ), for any N𝑁Nitalic_N, since 𝐡⁢(𝒯)>0⁢a.s.formulae-sequence𝐡𝒯0𝑎𝑠\mathbf{h}(\mathcal{T})>0\ a.s.bold_h ( caligraphic_T ) > 0 italic_a . italic_s . elementwisely on {0≤t1≤…≤tN≤T}0subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁𝑇\{0\leq t_{1}\leq\ldots\leq t_{N}\leq T\}{ 0 ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ … ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_T }. So ℒWSM⁢(θ)=0subscriptℒWSM𝜃0\mathcal{L}_{\text{WSM}}(\theta)=0caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT WSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) = 0 implies ∂log⁡λθ∗⁢(t)∂tsubscript𝜆superscript𝜃𝑡𝑡\frac{\partial\log\lambda_{\theta^{*}}(t)}{\partial t}divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t end_ARG = ∂log⁡λθ1⁢(t)∂t⁢a.e.formulae-sequencesubscript𝜆subscript𝜃1𝑡𝑡𝑎𝑒\frac{\partial\log\lambda_{\theta_{1}}(t)}{\partial t}\ a.e.divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_λ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t end_ARG italic_a . italic_e . on [0,T]0𝑇[0,T][ 0 , italic_T ]. By assumption, this implies θ1=θ∗subscript𝜃1superscript𝜃\theta_{1}=\theta^{*}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which completes the proof. ∎

A.3 Proof of Theorem 3.3

Proof.

The proof is basically the same as the proof of Proposition 3.1. We first expand the expectation and consider the cross-term in ℒWSM⁢(θ)subscriptℒWSM𝜃\mathcal{L}_{\text{WSM}}(\theta)caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT WSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ),

𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NT∂log⁡p⁢(𝒯)∂tn⁢∂log⁡pθ⁢(𝒯)∂tn⁢hn⁢(𝒯)]=∑N=1∞∫∑n=1N∂p⁢(𝒯)∂tn⁢∂log⁡pθ⁢(𝒯)∂tn⁢hn⁢(𝒯)⁢d⁢𝒯1:Nsubscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇𝑝𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑝𝜃𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯superscriptsubscript𝑁1superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁𝑝𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑝𝜃𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯𝑑subscript𝒯:1𝑁\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}\frac{\partial% \log p(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}}\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(\mathcal{T})% }{\partial t_{n}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})\right]=\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\int\sum_{n=1}^{% N}\frac{\partial p(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}}\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(% \mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})d\mathcal{T}_{1:N}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) ] = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (22)
=∑N=1∞{∫∑n=1Np(t1,…,tN)∂log⁡pθ⁢(𝒯)∂tnhn(𝒯)|tn=tn−1tn=tn+1d𝒯−n\displaystyle=\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\left\{\int\sum_{n=1}^{N}p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N}% )\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})% \Big{|}_{t_{n}=t_{n-1}}^{t_{n}=t_{n+1}}d\mathcal{T}_{-n}\right.= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT { ∫ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
−∫p(t1,…,tN)∑n=1N[∂2log⁡pθ⁢(𝒯)∂tn2hn(𝒯)+∂log⁡pθ⁢(𝒯)∂tn∂hn⁢(𝒯)∂tn]d𝒯1:N}.\displaystyle\left.-\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})\sum_{n=1}^{N}\left[\frac{% \partial^{2}\log p_{\theta}(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}^{2}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T}% )+\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}}\frac{\partial h_% {n}(\mathcal{T})}{\partial t_{n}}\right]d\mathcal{T}_{1:N}\right\}.- ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ divide start_ARG ∂ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) + divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG divide start_ARG ∂ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } .

We denote tN+1=Tsubscript𝑡𝑁1𝑇t_{N+1}=Titalic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_T and t0=0subscript𝑡00t_{0}=0italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 here. Using the first two equations in Equation 9, we have:

∫[p⁢(t1,…,tN)⁢∂log⁡pθ⁢(t1,…,tN)∂tn⁢hn⁢(𝒯)]|tn=tn+1⁢d⁢𝒯−n=0,∀n∈[N],formulae-sequenceevaluated-atdelimited-[]𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑝𝜃subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑑subscript𝒯𝑛0for-all𝑛delimited-[]𝑁\displaystyle\int[p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(t_{1},% \ldots,t_{N})}{\partial t_{n}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})]\big{|}_{t_{n}=t_{n+1}}d% \mathcal{T}_{-n}=0,\forall n\in[N],∫ [ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) ] | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 , ∀ italic_n ∈ [ italic_N ] ,
∫[p⁢(t1,…,tN)⁢∂log⁡pθ⁢(t1,…,tN)∂tn⁢hn⁢(𝒯)]|tn=tn−1⁢d⁢𝒯−n=0,∀n∈[N].formulae-sequenceevaluated-atdelimited-[]𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑝𝜃subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑑subscript𝒯𝑛0for-all𝑛delimited-[]𝑁\displaystyle\int[p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})\frac{\partial\log p_{\theta}(t_{1},% \ldots,t_{N})}{\partial t_{n}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})]\big{|}_{t_{n}=t_{n-1}}d% \mathcal{T}_{-n}=0,\forall n\in[N].∫ [ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) ] | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 , ∀ italic_n ∈ [ italic_N ] .

Therefore, the first intractable summation term in Equation 22 will disappear, and the second term equals −𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NT∂∂tn⁢ψθ⁢(tn)⁢hn⁢(𝒯)+ψθ⁢(tn)⁢∂∂tn⁢hn⁢(𝒯)]subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜓𝜃subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯subscript𝜓𝜃subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯-\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}\frac{\partial}{\partial t% _{n}}\psi_{\theta}(t_{n})h_{n}(\mathcal{T})+\psi_{\theta}(t_{n})\frac{\partial% }{\partial t_{n}}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})\right]- blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) + italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) ]. The existence of such an expectation is due to the last two equations in Equation 9. Therefore, we complete the proof.

∎

We can see from the proof that, in Equation 9, the first two equations ensure that the integration by parts trick does not produce an intractable term, and the last two equations are simply regularity conditions that ensure all terms are well-defined.

Appendix B Proof of Results in Section 4

Lemma B.1.

Let f⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) be a function of tn,ℱtn−1subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where n∈{1,…,NT}𝑛1…subscript𝑁𝑇n\in\{1,\ldots,N_{T}\}italic_n ∈ { 1 , … , italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. Then we have

𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NTf⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)]=∑n=1∞∫p⁢(t1,…,tn)⁢f⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑𝒯1:n,subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝒯:1𝑛\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1% }})\right]=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n})f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t% _{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n},blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

where p⁢(t1,…,tn)𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n})italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is the density of observing these timestamps, the integration is taken over {0≤t1≤…≤tn≤T}0subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝑇\{0\leq t_{1}\leq\ldots\leq t_{n}\leq T\}{ 0 ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ … ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_T }.

Proof.

We first expand the expectation and obtain,

𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NTf⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)]=∑N=1∞∫p⁢(t1,…,tN)⁢∑n=1Nf⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)⁢d⁢𝒯subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1superscriptsubscript𝑁1𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑁superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑑𝒯\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}f(t_{n},% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})\right]=\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})% \sum_{n=1}^{N}f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T
=\displaystyle== ∑N=1∞{∫∫∑n=1N−1p(t1,…,tn)p(tn+1,…,tN|ℱtn)f(tn,ℱtn−1)d𝒯n+1:Nd𝒯1:n\displaystyle\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\Big{\{}\int\int\sum_{n=1}^{N-1}p(t_{1},\ldots% ,t_{n})p(t_{n+1},\ldots,t_{N}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}})f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}% })d\mathcal{T}_{n+1:N}d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT { ∫ ∫ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 : italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
+∫p(t1,…,tN)p(NT=N|ℱtN)f(tN,ℱtN−1)d𝒯}.\displaystyle+\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{N})p(N_{T}=N|\mathcal{F}_{t_{N}})f(t_{N},% \mathcal{F}_{t_{N-1}})d\mathcal{T}\Big{\}}.+ ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T } .

At this point, we need to first integrate out tn+1,…,tNsubscript𝑡𝑛1…subscript𝑡𝑁t_{n+1},\ldots,t_{N}italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which uses

∫p⁢(tn+1,…,tN|ℱtn)⁢𝑑𝒯n+1:N=p⁢(NT=N|ℱtn).𝑝subscript𝑡𝑛1…conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑁subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛differential-dsubscript𝒯:𝑛1𝑁𝑝subscript𝑁𝑇conditional𝑁subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛\int p(t_{n+1},\ldots,t_{N}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}})d\mathcal{T}_{n+1:N}=p(N_{T}=N% |\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}}).∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n + 1 : italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_p ( italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Plug this in and we obtain,

𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NTf⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)]subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}f(t_{n},% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] =∑N=1∞∫∑n=1Np⁢(t1,…,tn)⁢p⁢(NT=N|ℱtn)⁢f⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)⁢d⁢𝒯1:nabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝑁1superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝑝subscript𝑁𝑇conditional𝑁subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑑subscript𝒯:1𝑛\displaystyle=\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\int\sum_{n=1}^{N}p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n})p(N_{T% }=N|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}})f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=∑N=1∞∑n=1N∫p⁢(t1,…,tn)⁢p⁢(NT=N|ℱtn)⁢f⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑𝒯1:nabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝑁1superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝑝subscript𝑁𝑇conditional𝑁subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝒯:1𝑛\displaystyle=\sum_{N=1}^{\infty}\sum_{n=1}^{N}\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n})p(N_{% T}=N|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}})f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=∑n=1∞∫p⁢(t1,…,tn)⁢f⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)⁢∑N=n∞p⁢(NT=N|ℱtn)⁢d⁢𝒯1:nabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1superscriptsubscript𝑁𝑛𝑝subscript𝑁𝑇conditional𝑁subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛𝑑subscript𝒯:1𝑛\displaystyle=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n})f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}% _{t_{n-1}})\sum_{N=n}^{\infty}p(N_{T}=N|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=∑n=1∞∫p⁢(t1,…,tn)⁢f⁢(tn,ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑𝒯1:n.absentsuperscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝑓subscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝒯:1𝑛\displaystyle=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n})f(t_{n},\mathcal{F}% _{t_{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}.= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_f ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

The thrid equation adopts the exchange of summation. The feasibility is ensured by the assumption that the expectation in the left side of the equation exists and Fubini’s theorem. The fourth equation use the fact that ∑N=n∞p⁢(NT=N|ℱtn)=1superscriptsubscript𝑁𝑛𝑝subscript𝑁𝑇conditional𝑁subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1\sum_{N=n}^{\infty}p(N_{T}=N|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n}})=1∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = 1.

∎

B.1 Proof of Proposition 4.1

Proof.

We use Lemma B.1 to the cross term of ℒASM⁢(θ)subscriptℒASM𝜃\mathcal{L}_{\text{ASM}}(\theta)caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ASM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) and obtain,

𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NTψ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢ψθ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)]subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇𝜓conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}\psi(t_{n}|% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})\psi_{\theta}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ψ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=∑n=1∞∫p⁢(t1,…⁢tn)⁢ψ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢ψθ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑𝒯1:nabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛𝜓conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝒯:1𝑛\displaystyle=\sum_{n=1}^{\infty}\int p(t_{1},\ldots t_{n})\psi(t_{n}|\mathcal% {F}_{t_{n-1}})\psi_{\theta}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}= ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ψ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=∫t0Tp⁢(t1|ℱt0)⁢∂log⁡p⁢(t1|ℱt0)∂t1⁢ψθ⁢(t1|ℱt0)⁢𝑑t1absentsuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑡0𝑇𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0subscript𝑡1subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0differential-dsubscript𝑡1\displaystyle=\int_{t_{0}}^{T}p(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}})\frac{\partial\log p% (t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}})}{\partial t_{1}}\psi_{\theta}(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t% _{0}})dt_{1}= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
+∑n=2∞∫p⁢(t1,…,tn−1)⁢p⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢∂log⁡p⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)∂tn⁢ψθ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑𝒯1:nsuperscriptsubscript𝑛2𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝒯:1𝑛\displaystyle+\sum_{n=2}^{\infty}\int p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n-1})p(t_{n}|\mathcal{% F}_{t_{n-1}})\frac{\partial\log p(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})}{\partial t_{n}% }\psi_{\theta}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})d\mathcal{T}_{1:n}+ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ roman_log italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 : italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=∫t0T∂p⁢(t1|ℱt0)∂t1⁢ψθ⁢(t1|ℱt0)⁢𝑑t1+∑n=2∞∫∫tn−1Tp⁢(t1,…,tn−1)⁢∂p⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)∂tn⁢ψθ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑tn⁢𝑑𝒯1:n−1absentsuperscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑡0𝑇𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0subscript𝑡1subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0differential-dsubscript𝑡1superscriptsubscript𝑛2superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑇𝑝subscript𝑡1…subscript𝑡𝑛1𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝑡𝑛differential-dsubscript𝒯:1𝑛1\displaystyle=\int_{t_{0}}^{T}\frac{\partial p(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}})}{% \partial t_{1}}\psi_{\theta}(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}})dt_{1}+\sum_{n=2}^{% \infty}\int\int_{t_{n-1}}^{T}p(t_{1},\ldots,t_{n-1})\frac{\partial p(t_{n}|% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})}{\partial t_{n}}\psi_{\theta}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1% }})dt_{n}d{\mathcal{T}}_{1:n-1}= ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG ∂ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , … , italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - =p⁢(t1|ℱt0)⁢ψθ⁢(t1|ℱt0)|t1=t0t1=T−∫t0Tp⁢(t1|ℱt0)⁢∂ψθ⁢(t1|ℱt0)∂t1⁢𝑑t1absentevaluated-at𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0subscript𝑡1subscript𝑡0subscript𝑡1𝑇superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑡0𝑇𝑝conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡1subscriptℱsubscript𝑡0subscript𝑡1differential-dsubscript𝑡1\displaystyle=p(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}})\psi_{\theta}(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{% 0}})\big{|}_{t_{1}=t_{0}}^{t_{1}=T}-\int_{t_{0}}^{T}p(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}% })\frac{\partial\psi_{\theta}(t_{1}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{0}})}{\partial t_{1}}dt_{1}= italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) divide start_ARG ∂ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG italic_d italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG start_ARG ∂ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ] .

For the fifth equation, we simply rearrange the terms. We recall that the notation p⁢(𝒯:0)𝑝subscript𝒯:absent0p(\mathcal{T}_{:0})italic_p ( caligraphic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT : 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) equals one. For the last equation, we use Lemma B.1 again. This will be sufficient to complete the proof. ∎

B.2 Proof of Theorem 4.2

Proof.

First, since ℒAWSM⁢(θ)≥0subscriptℒAWSM𝜃0\mathcal{L}_{\text{AWSM}}(\theta)\geq 0caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT AWSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ) ≥ 0 and ℒAWSM⁢(θ∗)=0subscriptℒAWSMsuperscript𝜃0\mathcal{L}_{\text{AWSM}}(\theta^{*})=0caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT AWSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = 0, we see θ∗superscript𝜃\theta^{*}italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a minimizer. If there exists another minimizer θ1subscript𝜃1\theta_{1}italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then we have

ℒAWSM⁢(θ1)=12⁢∑N=1∞∫∑n=1N[ψθ∗⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)−ψθ1⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)]2⁢hn⁢(𝒯)⁢d⁢𝒯=0.subscriptℒAWSMsubscript𝜃112superscriptsubscript𝑁1superscriptsubscript𝑛1𝑁superscriptdelimited-[]subscript𝜓superscript𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝜓subscript𝜃1conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛12subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯𝑑𝒯0\displaystyle\mathcal{L}_{\text{AWSM}}(\theta_{1})=\frac{1}{2}\sum_{N=1}^{% \infty}\int\sum_{n=1}^{N}[\psi_{\theta^{*}}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})-\psi_% {\theta_{1}}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})]^{2}h_{n}(\mathcal{T})d\mathcal{T}=0.caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT AWSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∞ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∫ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT [ italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) italic_d caligraphic_T = 0 .

By the definition of hn⁢(𝒯)subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯h_{n}(\mathcal{T})italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ), we have hn⁢(𝒯)>0,a.s.formulae-sequencesubscriptℎ𝑛𝒯0𝑎𝑠h_{n}(\mathcal{T})>0,\ a.s.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) > 0 , italic_a . italic_s . on 0≤t1≤…,≤tN≤T0\leq t_{1}\leq\ldots,\leq t_{N}\leq T0 ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ … , ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_T for any n≤N𝑛𝑁n\leq Nitalic_n ≤ italic_N and N∈ℕ+𝑁subscriptℕN\in\mathbb{N}_{+}italic_N ∈ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This implies, for any n≤N𝑛𝑁n\leq Nitalic_n ≤ italic_N and N∈ℕ+𝑁subscriptℕN\in\mathbb{N}_{+}italic_N ∈ blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, ψθ∗⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)=ψθ1⁢(tn|ℱtn−1),a.e.formulae-sequencesubscript𝜓superscript𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝜓subscript𝜃1conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑎𝑒\psi_{\theta^{*}}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})=\psi_{\theta_{1}}(t_{n}|% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}}),\ a.e.italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_a . italic_e . on {0≤tn−1≤tn≤T}0subscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑡𝑛𝑇\{0\leq t_{n-1}\leq t_{n}\leq T\}{ 0 ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_T }. Therefore we have

log⁡pθ∗⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)=log⁡pθ1⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)+C,a.e.,formulae-sequencesubscript𝑝superscript𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝑝subscript𝜃1conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝐶𝑎𝑒\log p_{\theta^{*}}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})=\log p_{\theta_{1}}(t_{n}|% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})+C,a.e.,roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_log italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + italic_C , italic_a . italic_e . ,

And we conclude that C=0𝐶0C=0italic_C = 0 since ∫tn−1Tpθ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢𝑑tn=1superscriptsubscriptsubscript𝑡𝑛1𝑇subscript𝑝𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1differential-dsubscript𝑡𝑛1\int_{t_{n-1}}^{T}p_{\theta}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})dt_{n}=1∫ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1. Then by assumption, we have pθ∗(tn|ℱtn−1)=pθ1(tn|ℱtn−1)a.e.⇒θ1=θ∗p_{\theta^{*}}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})=p_{\theta_{1}}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{% t_{n-1}})\ a.e.\Rightarrow\theta_{1}=\theta^{*}italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_a . italic_e . ⇒ italic_θ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_θ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. ∎

B.3 Proof of Theorem 4.3

The proof is basically the same as the proof of Proposition 4.1. We first use the Lemma B.1 to the cross term of ℒAWSM⁢(θ)subscriptℒAWSM𝜃\mathcal{L}_{\text{AWSM}}(\theta)caligraphic_L start_POSTSUBSCRIPT AWSM end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_θ ),

𝔼p⁢(𝒯)⁢[∑n=1NTψ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢ψθ⁢(tn|ℱtn−1)⁢hn⁢(𝒯)]subscript𝔼𝑝𝒯delimited-[]superscriptsubscript𝑛1subscript𝑁𝑇𝜓conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscript𝜓𝜃conditionalsubscript𝑡𝑛subscriptℱsubscript𝑡𝑛1subscriptℎ𝑛𝒯\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{p(\mathcal{T})}\left[\sum_{n=1}^{N_{T}}\psi(t_{n}|% \mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})\psi_{\theta}(t_{n}|\mathcal{F}_{t_{n-1}})h_{n}(\mathcal% {T})\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( caligraphic_T ) end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n = 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ψ ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_ψ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_θ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( caligraphic_T ) ]
